net.viktorc.pspp

Class PSPPool

  • Object
    • PSPPool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class PSPPool
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    A class for maintaining and managing a pool of identical pre-started processes.
    Author:
    A6714

    • Constructor Detail

      • PSPPool

        public PSPPool(ProcessBuilder builder,
               ProcessListener listener,
               int minPoolSize,
               int maxPoolSize,
               int reserveSize,
               long keepAliveTime)
        throws IOException,
               IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a pool of identical processes. The initial size of the pool is the minimum pool size. The size of the pool is dynamically adjusted based on the number of requests and running processes.
        Parameters:
        builder - The process builder for building the pooled processes.
        listener - A ProcessListener instance that is added to each process in the pool. It should be stateless as the same instance is used for all processes.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are cancelled. If it is 0 or less, the life-cycle of the processes will not be limited.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the process cannot be started.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the minimum pool size is less than 0, or the maximum pool size is less than the minimum pool size or 1, or the reserve size is less than 0 or greater than the maximum pool size, or the listener is null.

    • Method Detail

      • setLogging

        public void setLogging(boolean on)
        Sets whether the pool should log to the console.
        Parameters:
        on - Whether the pool should log to the console.

      • submitCommand

        public Future<Long> submitCommand(CommandSubmission submission)
        Executes the command on any of the available processes in the pool. It blocks until the command could successfully be submitted for execution.
        Parameters:
        submission - The command submission including all information necessary for executing and processing the command.
        Returns:
        A Future instance of the time it took to execute the command including the submission delay in nanoseconds.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the command is null or empty or if the command listener is null.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws Exception
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Exception
